title: DOGE hijacks federal grants platform
description: Elon Musk's DOGE team took over grants.gov, delaying ~30 federal grant postings worth tens of millions, prompting restoration orders due to politicized interference.

title: Judge blocks Trump order targeting law firm Susman Godfrey
description: Federal judge ruled Trump's executive order suspending contracts and clearances for Susman Godfrey was unconstitutional and retaliatory.

title: High court limits injunctions, empowering Trump's agenda
description: Supreme Court ruling curtails power of nationwide injunctions—cited by Trump and Bondi as enabling actions like deportations and citizenship rollbacks.

title: FTC probes ad boycott claims tied to Musk's X
description: Media Matters sued FTC, alleging the probe was retaliation influenced by Elon Musk and aimed at silencing critics over extremist ads on X.

title: Media Matters alleges FTC/X collusion
description: Unverified claim that FTC's ad boycott probe of Media Matters was politically motivated and coordinated with Musk's X as retaliation.

title: Musk conflicts of interest in government role
description: Critics warned Musk kept control of Tesla/SpaceX while heading DOGE, approving federal contracts for his own companies—raising conflict-of-interest alarms.

title: Lawsuits challenge Musk's DOGE authority
description: Two lawsuits filed alleging Musk ran DOGE without Senate confirmation, misused access to federal data, blocked payments, and dismantled agencies unconstitutionally.

title: Trump revokes security clearances of prominent lawyers
description: Presidential memo stripped security clearances from 14 lawyers including Alvin Bragg and Letitia James; several have sued claiming retaliation.

title: Trump issues EO targeting WilmerHale law firm
description: Executive Order 14250 suspended WilmerHale lawyers' security clearances, access and contracts—a federal judge blocked it as unconstitutional retaliation.

title: DOJ orders dropping corruption case against NYC mayor
description: Unverifiable internal DOJ memo directed prosecutors to drop the case against Mayor Eric Adams, triggering seven resignations and raising politicization concerns.

title: ICE detains Native Americans at checkpoint
description: ICE agents, unaware CDIB cards count as U.S. citizenship proof, detained multiple Navajo individuals during raids, sparking tribal outcry over profiling.

title: DOJ halts foreign bribery investigations
description: Trump DOJ suspended investigations into overseas corruption and disbanded an FBI task force probing foreign election interference.

title: Ex-Rep. George Santos sentenced for corruption
description: Expelled NY Rep. George Santos received over 7 years prison for campaign finance and fraud schemes.

title: Court: US citizen detained due to ICE error
description: Federal court ruled Peter Sean Brown, a U.S. citizen, was illegally detained by ICE under a mistaken detainer violating 4th Amendment rights.

title: Pregnant US citizen detained in Alabama raid
description: Leonardo Garcia Venegas, a U.S. citizen with REAL ID, was handcuffed during ICE raid before being released after verifying status.

title: Pregnant woman arrested alongside undocumented partner
description: U.S. citizen Cary López Alvarado was arrested while pregnant during ICE raid; footage shows her refusing to move off private property.

title: LA immigrant raids spark mass protests
description: Over 500 detained in immigration raids across Los Angeles; National Guard mobilized amid clashes and civil rights complaints.

title: Immigrant journalist detained by ICE
description: Atlanta-based Salvadoran journalist Mario Guevara, identified as press, was detained covering protests—raising press freedom concerns.

title: ICE agents attempt entry into Dodger Stadium lot
description: ICE was turned away from stadium parking lot; debate arose over whether CBP or ICE agents and possible LAPD collusion.

title: US citizen detained at LA street vendor raid
description: ICE arrested a U.S. citizen street vendor; LAPD accused of assisting federal agents, prompting protests.

title: Mother with cancer detained in LA courthouse
description: A Honduran mother and her six-year-old leukemia son were arrested outside LA court despite legal residency and medical need.

title: Protests at Palantir NYC office
description: Six arrested blocking Palantir NYC office amid protests over its $30M ICE deportation software contract.

title: Bay Area Palantir protest draws 200 demonstrators
description: Over 100 protesters blockaded Palantir's Palo Alto office, condemning its role in surveillance and deportations.

title: Stephen Miller holds stake in Palantir
description: Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller owns $100k–250k in Palantir stock while pushing contracts for ImmigrationOS—raising conflict concerns.

title: ICE pays Palantir $30M for ImmigrationOS
description: ICE awarded $30M contract to Palantir for deportation tracking software—no competitive bidding amid civil liberties outcry.

title: Bondi fires three Jan 6 prosecutors
description: Attorney General Bondi abruptly dismissed at least three career DOJ prosecutors overseeing Jan 6 cases without explanation, raising alarms about politicized purges within the Department.

title: Bondi denies knowledge of masked ICE raids
description: Bondi claimed she was unaware of ICE agents wearing masks during raids, despite video evidence, prompting criticism over transparency and enforcement tactics.

title: Bondi grilled over Qatar ties
description: Bondi dodged questions in congressional hearing about undisclosed work and a jet linked to Qatar, raising concerns over conflicts of interest and disclosure failures.

title: Bondi deflects on Trump crypto stake query
description: In Senate hearing, Bondi refused to address concerns about a $2 billion UAE investment in Trump's crypto venture, pivoting to drug trafficking instead—raising questions about transparency.

title: Ethics complaint filed against Speaker Johnson
description: A formal ethics complaint accuses Speaker Johnson of failing to disclose financial holdings and potential conflicts tied to donations and stock holdings.

title: Musk backtracks on Trump criticism after White House outreach
description: Musk publicly apologized for critical posts about Trump after reaching out to administration officials, sparking concerns about political influence over private billionaire speech.

title: Trump and Musk trade insults in public feud
description: Musk and Trump escalated a bitter public spat involving slurs about deficits and political influence, exposing underlying tensions despite former alliance.

title: Dozens of Jan 6 prosecutors purged
description: DOJ removed 25–30 career prosecutors working on Jan 6 cases, considered part of a sweeping purge targeting personnel involved in investigations of Trump supporters.

title: Trump pardons 1,500 Jan 6 rioters
description: Trump issued pardons to over 1,500 individuals involved in the January 6 Capitol breach immediately after taking office.

title: Trump bypasses Congress for Iran strikes
description: Trump authorized U.S. airstrikes on Iranian nuclear sites without consulting Congress, raising constitutional war‑powers objections.

title: Iran missiles hit U.S. base in Qatar
description: Iran launched missiles at the Al‑Udeid Air Base in Qatar, prompting regional escalation but causing no reported casualties.

title: Iran threatens to close Strait of Hormuz
description: Iran's parliament voted to consider closing the Strait of Hormuz as retaliation for U.S. strikes—threatening global oil supply.

title: Congress delays Iran briefing
description: Speaker Johnson and Senate Republicans delayed classified briefing on Iran strikes, sparking backlash from Senate Dems over transparency.

title: Trump Mobile smartphone launched
description: Trump's sons launched a $499 Trump‑branded smartphone through their business, drawing scrutiny over using the presidency for commercial gain.

title: Trump reports $600M+ income; crypto & phone included
description: Donald Trump disclosed over $600 million in 2024 income—much from crypto ventures and Trump Mobile—raising conflict‑of‑interest concerns.

title: Trump meme‑coin $TRUMP backfires
description: Though $TRUMP token soared initially, it then crashed; yet Trump profited ~$320 M from fees, while many small investors suffered losses.

title: Trump hosts private $TRUMP dinner at golf club
description: Trump held an exclusive dinner for top meme‑coin holders, offering policy access—ethics groups called it Mount Everest of American corruption.

title: World Liberty Financial crypto scandal
description: World Liberty Financial, majority‑owned by Trump family, took in foreign investments (Justin Sun, Abu Dhabi) amid conflicts and relaxed SEC scrutiny.

title: Don Jr. grilled over $TRUMP coin
description: On CNBC, Jr. deflected criticism about $TRUMP's influence and insider deals, raising concerns about undisclosed foreign investment access.

title: Trump sons distance from $TRUMP wallet app
description: They publicly denied involvement in $TRUMP Wallet app launched by third party, amid confusion over branding and endorsement.

title: $TRUMP copycat tokens flood market
description: Over 700 spoof tokens surfaced imitating Trump's meme‑coin, misleading investors and raising fraud concerns.

title: Trump launches $TRUMP meme‑coin
description: The official $TRUMP token debuted days before inauguration; Trump-affiliated entities held 80% of supply and netted ~$350 M in sales/fees.

title: Trump Announces 2026 Campaign Rally Schedule
description: Former President Donald Trump has announced a series of campaign rallies scheduled for the summer of 2026 as he prepares for a potential run in the upcoming presidential election.

title: Test entry
description: This is a test.

title: Test entry
description: This is a test.

title: Musk Accused of Influencing Political Discourse on Social Media
description: In recent days, Elon Musk faced criticism for allegedly using his social media platforms to sway public opinion regarding key political issues. Analysts suggest that his high-profile tweets may be impacting voter sentiment ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Federal judges strike down Trump law firm orders
description: Four federal judges ruled that Trump’s executive orders targeting specific law firms are unconstitutional and violate separation of powers, issuing permanent injunctions that the White House has not appealed.

title: Musk’s DOGE unit accessed sensitive federal data
description: The DOGE unit led by Musk gained access to nonpublic data across NASA, CFPB, and Labor—prompting concerns about conflicts of interest and potential misuse tied to his private businesses.

title: DOJ sues Los Angeles over sanctuary policies
description: The Justice Department filed suit against Los Angeles, claiming sanctuary policies are obstructing federal immigration law enforcement and deploying National Guard troops to enforce compliance.

title: Trump appeals blocking of Perkins Coie order
description: The administration appealed a judge’s ruling that struck down Trump’s executive order targeting Perkins Coie, which sought to revoke their security clearances and federal contracts.

title: Trump defends EEOC firing amid legal challenge
description: The administration moved to dismiss a lawsuit by former EEOC Commissioner Jocelyn Samuels, arguing Trump had broad authority to remove commissioners despite EEOC’s independent status.

title: Musk slams Trump spending bill on X
description: Musk criticized Trump’s $3.3T spending legislation as ‘utterly insane,’ called for a new political party, and threatened lawmakers who supported it—escalating their public feud.

title: Supreme Court limits nationwide injunctions
description: The Supreme Court ruled to curtail federal judges’ authority to issue nationwide injunctions, altering the balance of judicial oversight in major federal policy disputes.

title: Bondi dodges questions on Trump crypto deal with UAE
description: At a Senate hearing, Bondi declined to address concerns that a $2 billion UAE investment in Trump’s World Liberty Financial crypto could influence U.S. policy, deflecting to unrelated drug trafficking issues.

title: Bondi claims ignorance on ICE agents wearing masks
description: Bondi said she was unaware ICE agents wore masks during raids despite video proof, prompting critics to compare the tactic to authoritarian behavior and heighten public safety concerns.

title: DOGE expands Grok AI use in federal agencies
description: Musk’s DOGE pushed a customized Grok AI chatbot into DHS and other agencies without approval, raising conflict-of-interest and privacy concerns over handling sensitive data.

actor: Donald Trump / Defense Sec. Pete Hegseth
title: Trump deploys National Guard to L.A. amid ICE protests
description: Trump federalized ~2,000 National Guard troops and put 700 Marines on standby to respond to protests over ICE raids in Los Angeles, bypassing state approval and igniting debate over federal overreach.

title: Appeals court allows Trump to keep Guard in L.A.
description: A federal appeals court temporarily blocked a lower court order to return control of California’s National Guard to the governor, allowing Trump’s deployment to continue while litigation continues.

title: Trump holds $25–45M military parade in DC
description: Trump staged the first major military parade in DC since 1991, coinciding with Army’s 250th birthday and his own 79th; critics said it politicized the military and appeared tied to authoritarian pageantry amid recent Guard deployment.
